front.title: On-Path delay Data-field for In Situ Operations, Administration, and Maintenance (IOAM)

abstract.t: This document defines a Data-Field to allow the export of on-path delay information using In Situ Operations, Administration, and Maintenance (IOAM).

section.title: Introduction
section.t: Network operators need to mesure the On-Path delay accross their network to monitor the proper functionning of their infrastructure and applications.
In this draft, we propose to export delay measurement results based on the timestamp seconds and timestamp fractions fields of the IOAM data fields.
In Passport-mode, the reference timestamp is obtained from IOAM Trace-type Data-Field. In IOAM Direct Export , can be used to add a timestamp into the header.
This document introduces a data field in the IOAM architecture to export delay information, and uses a bit in the IOAM, trace-type registry to trigger the export behaviour.

section.t: In Passport-mode, telemetry data is added to the data-plane packet at each node of the IOAM-domain and all collected metrics are exported in the decapsulation node.

section.title: Solution overview RM
section.t:
The IOAM Trace-Type Data-fields are defined in Section 4.4.2. These Data-fields allow exporting telemetry data in both IOAM Trace-Type Option and IOAM DEX Option .
In IOAM Trace-Type option, the delay can be added at each transit node and decapsulation node using the Pre-allocated and Incremental Trace-Option header and can be exported using . In IOAM DEX Option , using a Postcard-mode approach, the delay can be exported to a collector using IPFIX allowing to aggregate the On-path delay in the IPFIX exporter on the transit and decapsulation node.

The On-path delay has been defined in using performance metrics . The delay is computed between the encapsulating node in the IOAM domain and the transit or decapsulating node as shown in . The computed delays in are computed as following:

section.t: This document proposes a 32-bit field allowing the export of the On-Path delay using IOAM. The Data-Field is allocated by IANA, as defined in .

section.title: On-Path delay Data-field
section.t: The "On-Path Delay" field is a 4-octet unsigned integer field. This field indicates the on-path delay between the encapsulation node and the transit or decapsulation node mesured in microseconds.

section.title: Security Considerations
section.t: The security considerations for the IOAM Trace-Type and IOAM DEX Option-type are defined in and in . This document adds no additional security considerations.

section.title: IANA Considerations
section.t: This document requests IANA to add the following bit in the "IOAM Trace-Type" Registry.

figure.artwork: Bit: 12 Description: On-path delay between the encapsulated node and the transit or decapsulating node measured in milliseconds. Reference: this document
